Amongst his "creations" are the [[Comic Sans]] font , and the [[Trebuchet MS]] font. Besides text typefaces he finalized and [[font_hinting|hinted]] the font [[Marlett]] which has been used for scalable User Interface icons in [[Microsoft Windows]] since 1995 and created portions of the font [[Webdings]] that was first shipped with [[Internet Explorer]]. He currently works in the [[United Kingdom|UK]] for [[Dalton Maag]], an independent font design studio. ==Education== Connare studied at [[Milford High School (Massachusetts)|Milford High School]] in [[Milford, Massachusetts]] and the [[New York Institute of Technology]], and gained a master's degree in Type Design at the [[University of Reading]].<ref name=ABC/><ref>{{Cite web | title =Vincent Connare | work =Designers | publisher =Typophile | date = | url =http://typophile.com/node/17374 | accessdate =October 21, 2010 }}</ref> == References == *[http://www.microsoft.com/typography/hinting/tutorial.htm Basic hinting philosophies and TrueType instructions:Microsoft CorporatÄ±on] *[http://www.microsoft.com/typography/developers/fdsspec/overview.aspx Character Design Standards:Microsoft Corporation] *[http://www.microsoft.com/typography/ProductionGuidelines.mspx Hinting and Production Guidelines: Microsoft Corporation] *[http://www.springerlink.com/content/g0fkuul9behtqyge/ Designing and Using Scalable Type for Display as Graphic Elements on Digital Devices.
